title: 107_s3074
content:
The Act titled "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2002" establishes temporary judgeships. The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2002" establishes temporary judgeships in various districts, including additional bankruptcy judges appointed for specific districts like California, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Maryland, and Michigan. The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2002" establishes temporary judgeships in various districts, including additional bankruptcy judges appointed for specific districts like Mississippi, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, Puerto Rico, and Tennessee. The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2002" creates new bankruptcy judge positions in districts like Tennessee, Virginia, South Carolina, and Nevada. Vacancies in these positions may not be filled under certain conditions. The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2002" prohibits filling vacancies for bankruptcy judges in certain districts like California and Delaware under specific conditions such as death, retirement, resignation, or removal of a judge occurring 5 years after their appointment dates. The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2002" prohibits filling vacancies for bankruptcy judges in specific districts like Southern District of Florida and District of Maryland under certain conditions like death, retirement, resignation, or removal of a judge occurring 5 years after their appointment dates. The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2002" prohibits filling vacancies for bankruptcy judges in specific districts like Southern District of Florida and District of Maryland under certain conditions like death, retirement, resignation, or removal of a judge occurring 5 years after their appointment dates. SEC. 3. EXTENSIONS.

The temporary office of bankruptcy judges in specific districts is extended until the first vacancy occurring in the office of a bankruptcy judge resulting from death, retirement, resignation, or removal, and occurring 5 years after the enactment of this Act. All other provisions of the Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 1992 remain applicable to these temporary offices.

SEC. 4. TECHNICAL AMENDMENTS. SEC. 4. TECHNICAL AMENDMENTS.

Amendments to title 28, United States Code, regarding the appointment of bankruptcy judges and their districts. Effective date of these amendments is upon enactment of the Act.
